description.narrative: Child centred, equity focused and costed national sector plans reflecting regional frameworks in place in 9 countries (OT 208) , which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, all girls and boys in 12 Eastern Caribbean countries benefit from rights-based laws, policies, programmes and institutions that provide equitable systems for positive development, lifelong learning and protection

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child centred, equity focused and costed national sector plans reflecting regional frameworks in place in 9 countries (OT 208)

description.narrative: Partnerships with the OECS Commission and Caribbean Disaster Management Agency have been instrumental in the engagement of stakeholders, particularly senior policy makers, for quality engagement in education sector planning including disaster risk reduction and response programming. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2017

title.narrative: Child centred, costed, equity focused ESPs that are aligned with the sub-regional/regional strategy in place
# of plans, policies and strategies that give prominence to DRR at national and sub-regional levels
Existence of a sub-regional education strategy approved by the OECS Ministers of Education
Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
c3b. Availability of a risk reduction strategy within the Education Sector Plan/Policy - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Initial work started in collaboration with OECS and CDEMA.

target.value: 2016:Concept Note developed for integration of DRR in Education
